Prebon followed the two alliance bots to the crash site, he decided 
that it would be the chance to replenish his troops. when he got 
close enough he saw the big picture. In order to carry the new bot 
into the Iron fist they'd have to drop the shields and open the door. 
He sat back and waited for the golden moment

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> Sorry I didn't reply till now!
> 
> ::Zardus/Starlight/Griplash/Astral::
> 
> Zardus's head snaps up as a ship flies by overhead, slamming into 
the 
> destroyed shore of Spain. He frowns, tapping his comm-link.
> 
> "Starlight, Astral, investigate that ship. Get me any survivers you 
> find."
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Starlight turns and walks over toward the crashed ship, Astral 
> climbing out of the water and coming with her.
> 
> "Think anyone's alive?" she asks.
> 
> He shakes his head. "I doubt anyone could survive that blast.
> 
> They approach the ship, and Starlight sees a body laying a little 
> ways away from the ship. "Look!"
> 
> They both jog toward the body, kneeling down near it. "Its alive."
> 
> Astral nods at the report. "No duh."
> 
> He takes the body by the shoulder, giving it a little shake.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> > 
> > Sorry this is so long. Just had a lot of really good ideas! ^..^
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > * He was at the end of the chains which bound him to a wall, 
> straining 
> > against them and putting as much strength into his back and legs 
to 
> try and 
> > break them.
> > There was something in the sir which was warning him, something 
> that smelled 
> > like something bad was going to happen! And the more time went by 
> the 
> > stronger that sense got.
> > The shackles around his wrists were biting deeply into the skin 
> that was 
> > under the gray and white fur which covered his entire body, the 
one 
> around 
> > his thickly furred neck choking slightly but unable to do any 
real 
> damage 
> > through the hair.
> > His claws bit deeply into the metal floor and left scratched, 
> scaring the 
> > smooth surface. He growled and panted as he strained, his pawed 
> hands 
> > clenched into fists.
> > His senses were going wild! They kept screaming at him to get 
away, 
> just to 
> > leave this ship and run away as far as he could. Leave everything 
> behind.
> > 	A woman dressed in a white coat walked up to the alloyed door 
> which was the 
> > only way out of his cell, a notepad in her hand and pencil tucked 
> behind her 
> > ear. She looked into the room through a thickly glassed window 
> crossed with 
> > little wires, looking at him as he kept on working on the binds 
> which held 
> > him.
> > But he knew this woman, and unlike the other people who would 
just 
> as easily 
> > strap him to a table like so many times before, she was kind and 
> gentle. 
> > Always talking to him whenever she happened to pass his way.
> > She was the one that wrote down his actions when they were doing 
> projects on 
> > him, watching too see what his reactions would be to them. But he 
> could tell 
> > that she didn't like the job.
> > 	His head lifted and he looked at her, leaning out at the very 
> limit of the 
> > chains and putting all of his weight into pulling. He could tell 
> that she 
> > was concerned, because even though the alloyed door he could 
smell 
> her.
> > His ears laid back flat against his head and he whined.
> > 	The woman sighed and leaned against the door, looking at 
> him.* " You really 
> > don't like it in there, do you, D?"
> > * He whined in response and pulled harder on the chains. He 
> understood her 
> > words and could even form a few of them, but other then that his 
> language 
> > was mainly based on howls and barks, growls and snarls.
> > They had made them, those people in the white coats. With wires 
and 
> bones, 
> > muscle and metal.
> > They had created a jeen which could combine organic with machine 
> and they 
> > had injected that into a living creature, and after painstaking 
> work and 
> > time HE was finally produced. Just what they had hoped.
> > He could walk on two legs and could walk on four, had a large 
> mental 
> > capacity and could learn easily and quickly. But he also had the 
> strength of 
> > a machine, his bones flecked with metal that made them harder to 
> break. Just 
> > like his muscles that were flecked too, and his mind. It was 
> incredible!
> > He could store away images and then get them to come up on his 
> vision 
> > whenever he wanted them to! Even he was impressed with that!
> > 	But today, there was just something that was going to happen, 
> maybe 
> > something that was going to go really wrong. He felt it, and he 
> didn't like 
> > it one bit!
> > He whined again as the ship seemed to tilt a little, making the 
> woman 
> > outside of his door hang onto the handle to keep her balance. The 
> pad in her 
> > arms slipped and skittered down the hall.*
> > " Whoa!"
> > * He growled and shook, the chains rattling. The ship seemed to 
> settle down 
> > and the woman patted at her hair to settle the strands which had 
> escaped the 
> > pins in it. She smiled through the window at him.*
> > 
> > " Life's full of surprises, huh?"
> > 
> > * She then left the window where he could see her and 
disappeared, 
> leaving 
> > him to strain and fight the bonds which held him to a ship of 
> danger.
> > The ship tilted and shook again, words blasting over a speaker 
> system in the 
> > halls.*
> > 
> > " WARNING! SubGama has slipped into the mainstream of a  class D 
> rift, all 
> > personnel please prepare for turbulence!"
> > 
> > * He shook again.
> > Rift! What was that, was it something to do with space? With the 
> lights 
> > outside the windows?! What was it? What was going on?!
> > All of a sudden everything begin to glow a bright white, making 
it 
> too hard 
> > for his eyes to adjust so he had to close them.
> > And that was all he knew last, but there was so much going on 
> outside that 
> > went by un-noticed by him.
> > 	 The entire ships systems had gone offline and the ship was 
> spit out of the 
> > rift, sent tumbling towards some blue and green planet that 
seemed 
> the only 
> > solid thing in the black void of space.
> > It wasn't long before the ship entered the weird planets' 
> atmosphere, 
> > becoming a red and melting fireball which lit up the sky. Almost 
> all life 
> > support on the ship had ceased to function, but his chamber was 
> luckily 
> > sealed by the woman and was operating perfectly. Where she was 
left 
> out with 
> > the rest, to share their fate.
> > 	The large scientific vessel thundered towards a piece of land 
> at a slant, 
> > the whole thing shaking and losing large bits a pieces of armor 
> only for 
> > them to drop towards a battle by the sea that it flew over. ( 
> alliance 
> > battle, not the CF.)
> > The ship skittered over the water for a second as it loses 
> velocity, hitting 
> > the beach and sending up a huge wall of sand. The impact digging 
> it's front 
> > into the land while the back was lifted up, the weight of the 
back 
> imploding 
> > it into the middle for a moment, hulls breaking in half before 
the 
> ship 
> > rocked so that it was standing straight up into the air for a 
split 
> second 
> > before toppling over. The broken back half of the ship was still 
> carrying 
> > out the velocity of the impact and was sent sliding into a new 
> forest, 
> > plowing trees and anything else in it's way before finally coming 
> to  
> > shattered stop in pieces.
> > Chemical tanks had burst on impact and soon caught fire from the 
> sparking 
> > wires of the ships systems, large explosions occurring in both 
> halves of the 
> > vessel. Burning each piece to the ground, leaving nothing but 
> charred metal 
> > and ash. The occasional burning body of one of the White Coats 
> littering the 
> > ground.
> > 	However, there was also one body that lay across the ground 
> which was not 
> > burning, instead limp as from the first second he had gone 
> unconscious. No 
> > broken bones and breathing in shallow breaths he simply lay 
there, 
> the 
> > shackles and chains still around his wrists and neck.
> > His chamber had been ripped from the ship as it broke in half, 
> carrying it 
> > along with the back half until it had stopped and he was thrown 
> through the 
> > wall and a bit into the forest.
> > Where he lay still, unmoving and unbeaten.*
> > 
> > 
>
